projectPurpose: To provide a fast and efficient tool for scanning network ports to identify open services on target hosts, often acting as a rapid initial scanner before using more comprehensive tools.
mainFeatures: Automatically pipes results into Nmap for further analysis
Flexible scripting engine support (Python, Lua, Shell)

alternatives.name: Nmap
alternatives.license: NPSL or modified GPLv2 or proprietary

alternatives.name: Masscan
alternatives.license: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0
mainFeatures: Supports arbitrary port and address ranges

alternatives.name: Unicornscan
mainFeatures: Active/passive remote OS and application identification

alternatives.name: Naabu
mainFeatures: Supports Stdin and Stdout for workflows

alternatives.name: Netcat
mainFeatures: Read and write data across network connections

marketPositioning: RustScan positions itself as a modern, high-speed port scanner focused on rapid initial port discovery. It aims to be faster than traditional scanners like Nmap for the initial port scan phase and complements them by providing seamless piping of results for deeper analysis. Its emphasis on speed, simplicity, and integration with established tools like Nmap differentiates it from more monolithic or solely speed-focused alternatives. It targets users who prioritize quick identification of open ports before performing more detailed network analysis.
